titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Navy V-12 Program Collection, 1943-1944

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The collection includes playbills which have advertisements for the V-12 program, football programs with images of the Navy V-12 unit, clippings, the Navy V-12 bulletin no. 101, a pamphlet, and other printed matter. There are three photographs: two are of the Duke Chapel in the snow; one shows seven members of the Navy V-12 on campus, in the snow, wearing their navy caps and ties and boxer shorts. The collection ranges in date from 1943-1944.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for official university records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Navy V-12 Program Collection, 1943-1944, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid derived from MARC record, November 2014

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: This material was donated by James M. Snyder, Jr. in 1997.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection includes playbills which have advertisements for the V-12 program, football programs with images of the Navy V-12 unit, clippings, the Navy V-12 bulletin no. 101, a pamphlet, and other printed matter. There are three photographs: two are of the Duke Chapel in the snow; one shows seven members of the Navy V-12 on campus, in the snow, wearing their navy caps and ties and boxer shorts. The collection ranges in date from 1943-1944.
